text: Iain Maxwell Stewart (1916-1985) was a Scottish industrialist. He was President of the Institution of Engineers and Shipbuilders in Scotland during which period he founded the Marlow lectures, which commenced in 1964. The name of the lectures derived from the Marlow Declaration of 1963. Stewart was a golfing partner with Sean Connery, a connection which led to the later making the film The Bowler and the Bunnet in 1967. He was knighted in 1968. ==References== Category:1916 births Category:1985 deaths Category:Scottish industrialists Category:Scottish knights
